page.title: 01Detling to Queen Down Warren
page.content: This block is on the edge of the North Downs and is quite hilly. The aea is manily covered by decidious trees and grassland. The grassland is mostly used for grazing sheep. The fields are divided by hedgerows. There is a disused airfield which is now partly used to house small workshops. Next tot he airfield is a grass area which is the Kent County Showground, in July the three day Kent Show is held there. There is one main Post Office and 2 main garages selling petrol and carrying out car repairs. Historic Buildings - one is a Motte and Bailey cstle mound and the other is a Second World War pillbox. There are a few buildings scattered in this aea, mainly farmhouses and farm builings. The roads are very narrow in some places. The main bus route runs on the Sittingbourne A249
